properties.name: Neurorama
properties.latestCompilationDirectory: C:\Users\Luis Vargas\Documents\Who am I games\Neurorama Game

events.comment: Replace every placeholder with a random card.
The second card has been revealed, wait a moment and turn cards again
A pair was found, remove the pair
No pair was found, cover back the cards
Replace every placeholder with a random card.
Preparacion
Cpu controla

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PanelSpriteButton
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A button that can be customized.
description: The button can be customized with a background for each state and a label. It handles user interactions and a simple condition can be used to check if it is clicked.
There are ready-to-use buttons in the asset-store [menu buttons pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=menu-buttons-menu-buttons).

changelog.breaking: - Buttons now use "variants", allowing easy swapping of their visual aspect. You will have to make some adjustments to existing buttons in your project. Follow this [migration documentation](https://wiki.gdevelop.io/gdevelop5/objects/custom-objects-prefab-template/migrate-to-variants/) to do these changes.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ButtonStates
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Use any object as a button and change appearance according to user interactions.
description: Use the "Button states" behavior to track user interactions with an object, including:
- Hovered
- Pressed
- Clicked
- Idle
Add additional behaviors to make juicy buttons with animated responses to user input:
- Size
- Color
- Animation
- Object effects

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ObjectStack
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: An ordered list of objects and a shuffle action.
description: It provides:
* Actions to modify a stack of objects
* Conditions to access the objects of a stack
* A shuffle action
It can be helpful for:
* Card games
* Fair randomness (for instance, to create a stack of predetermined bonus and randomize the order they appear)
3 examples use it:
* a card system demonstration ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://card-system))
* a Klondike solitaire ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://klondike-solitaire))
* a Zuma-like ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://smoothy))

eventsFunctions.description: Define helper classes JavaScript code.
eventsFunctions.name: DefineHelperClasses

for (let height = lowerBound; height <= upperBound; height++) {
for (let i = lowerBound; i <= upperBound; i++) {

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @Bouh, D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ExtendedVariables
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Add conditions, actions and expressions to check for the existence of a variable, copy variables, delete existing ones from memory, and create dynamic variables.
description: This extension provides:
- Conditions to check if a global/scene/object variable exists.
- Actions to copy object variables, global and scene variables.
- Actions to delete an existing global/scene variable from memory.
- Actions to create a global/scene variable using a text expression, rather than a variable name input.
- Expressions to get the value or text from a global/scene variable using a text expression, rather than a variable name.
Text expressions allows to enter the name of the variable with an expression like `"MyVar"+ ToString(Variable(Health))`

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ObjectPickingTools
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Adds various object picking related tools.
description: Adds various actions and conditions for advanced object selection. Includes picking objects with the highest or lowest Z-order (for 2D objects), an object variable, and the ability to unpick all objects.
If multiple instances have the highest/lowest Z-order, all of these instances will be picked.

eventsFunctions.description: Unpicks all instances of an object.
eventsFunctions.name: UnpickAction

parameters.description: The object to unpick all instances from
parameters.name: object

eventsFunctions.description: Unpicks all instances of an object.
eventsFunctions.name: UnpickCondition

parameters.description: The object to unpick all instances from
parameters.name: object

eventsFunctions.description: Pick object instances that have the lowest Z-order.
eventsFunctions.name: PickLowestZAction

inlineCode: // Create an empty array to hold the objects with the lowest value
// Initialize the lowest value to a very small number
// Loop through each object to find the lowest value
// Get the value of the variable
// Compare and update the lowest value
lowestValueObjects = [object]; // Reset the list to contain only this new lowest value object
lowestValueObjects.push(object); // If the value is equal to the current lowest, add it to the list
// Pick all object instances with the lowest value

// Initialize the lowest value to a very small number
// Loop through each object to find the lowest value
// Get the value of the variable
// Compare and update the lowest value
lowestValueObjects = [object]; // Reset the list to contain only this new lowest value object
lowestValueObjects.push(object); // If the value is equal to the current lowest, add it to the list
// Pick all object instances with the lowest value

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ValuesOfMultipleObjects
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Values of picked object instances (including position, size, force and angle).
description: Provides values based on picked object instances: minimum or average X or Y position, center position, width, height, 2D Z-order.
Useful for camera tracking, flocking behaviors, and more.
An example shows how to use the extension ([open the Itch.io page](https://victrisgames.itch.io/values-of-multiple-objects)).

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Gruk
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: TimedBackAndForthMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: This behavior moves objects back and forth for a chosen time or distance, vertically or horizontally.
description: This behavior moves an object (like an enemy) for a chosen time or distance, then flips it and starts over, moving the object back and forth, vertically or horizontally.
Note: animations must be facing **Right** (for horizontal) or **Down** (for vertical) direction.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Move an object (e.g. enemy) for a chosen time or distance, then flip it and start over.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: TimedBackAndForthMirroredMovement

events.comment: vertical mode
initialize
distance has been reached, flip it
max time has been reached, flip it
horizontal mode
initialize
distance has been reached, flip it
max time has been reached, flip it
store current elapsed time (to make sure time has passed)

propertyDescriptors.label: Move the object vertically (instead of horizontally)
propertyDescriptors.name: Vertical

propertyDescriptors.label: position of the sprite at the previous frame
propertyDescriptors.name: LastPosition

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Arthur Pacaud (arthuro555)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: AdvancedP2PEventHandling
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Allows handling all received P2P events at once instead of one per frame. It is more complex but also potentially more performant.
description: Allows handling all events at once instead of one per frame.
### Usage:
![Screenshot of the way to use the extension](https://i.imgur.com/DkYfM7W.png)

eventsFunctions.description: Marks the event as handled, to go on to the next.
eventsFunctions.name: DissmissEvent
